programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Nuggets look to keep rolling versus the Heat. Denver has won 11 of the last 12 meetings, with Miami's lone triumph coming in Game 2 of the 2023 NBA Finals. Michael Porter Jr.'s 30-point double-double spurred a 103-97 Nuggets victory Feb. 29.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Kings host the Lakers. Sacramento leads the season series 3-0 after winning a March 6 affair 130-120. De'Aaron Fox (SAC) tied his career high with 44 points, while Anthony Davis (LAL), who celebrated his 31st birthday March 11, double-doubled.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Kings host the Lakers. Sacramento leads the season series 3-0 after winning a March 6 affair 130-120. De'Aaron Fox (SAC) tied his career high with 44 points, while Anthony Davis (LAL), who celebrated his 31st birthday March 11, double-doubled.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Tar Heels face the No. 9 Seminoles in an ACC Tournament quarterfinal game. North Carolina has won four straight meetings, with Florida State's last victory coming in the 2021 semifinals. FSU booted No. 8 Virginia Tech from the second round.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Cougars begin pursuit of the Big 12 title as they hook up with the No. 8 Horned Frogs in the quarterfinals. TCU handed Houston one of its three losses, 68-67 in January. Houston, playing its first Big 12 season, has won nine in a row.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Blue Devils begin their ACC title defense by battling the No. 10 Wolfpack in the quarterfinals. Duke prevailed at NC State 79-64 on March 4 behind Jeremy Roach's 21 points. NC State advanced with victories over Louisville and Syracuse.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The upstart No. 11 Eagles run into the No. 3 Cavaliers in the ACC Tournament quarterfinals. Boston College has won four in a row after mowing down No. 6 Clemson 76-55 in the second round. Virginia prevailed in five of its last six versus BC.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Jayhawks draw the No. 11 Bearcats in the Big 12 Tournament's second round. First-year member Cincinnati notched a seventh-straight tournament-opening victory by surviving No. 14 West Virginia 90-85. Kansas is 5-1 in tourney play since 2022.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Big Sky Country sides play for the Big Sky title as the No. 3 Grizzlies face the No. 5 Bobcats. Montana State eyes a third straight crown, while Montana looks for its conference-best 12th championship. Montana State toppled Montana in the 1986 final.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Red Raiders face the No. 5 Cougars in the Big 12 Tournament quarterfinals. Texas Tech's Pop Isaacs scored 32 points in an 85-78 win over BYU on Jan. 20. Eight Cougars notched at least eight points in BYU's second-round win over No. 12 UCF.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Sides sitting on the NCAA Tournament bubble in the No. 4 Panthers and No. 5 Demon Deacons play an ACC quarterfinal. The teams split two 2023-24 meetings. Wake Forest ousted No. 12 Notre Dame in the second round 72-59 behind Kevin Miller's 17 points.

programme.desc: The No. 2 Cyclones battle the No. 10 Wildcats in the Big 12 Tournament quarterfinals. Kansas State kept its NCAA Tournament hopes alive with a 65-58 win over Iowa State in its regular-season finale. KSU dispatched No. 7 Texas in the second round.

programme.desc: The No. 10 Hoyas play the No. 7 Friars in the first round of the Big East Tournament. Providence has won six in a row over Georgetown. The Hoyas have yet to pick up a tournament victory since running all the way to an improbable league title in 2021.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.

programme.desc: The Hornets host the Suns. Phoenix has won six straight over Charlotte, including 133-119 on Dec. 29, 2023 in the desert. Vasilije Micic, a 30-year-old rookie from Serbia, was one of three Charlotte players to double-double in a home win March 9.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Hawks reach the second stop in a five-game trip when they face the Jazz. Atlanta blasted Utah 124-97 on Feb. 27. On this day in 1975, during the Jazz's inaugural season, Pistol Pete Maravich scored 24 points in a 140-123 decision over the Hawks.
